title: Validation Curves: Plotting Scores to Evaluate Models
description: In machine learning, every estimator has its advantages and drawbacks. The generalization error of an estimator can be decomposed into bias, variance, and noise. The bias of an estimator is the average error for different training sets, while the variance indicates its sensitivity to varying training sets. Noise is a property of the data.
